summary: This is a Daily Activity Report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 12, 2019. It details routine prison operations, staff shortages, inmate counts, and administrative data. The report is significant as it originates from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died, providing context on its operational status around that time.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations at MCC New York
events.description: Routine prison operations including staff assignments, inmate counts, and administrative reporting. The report notes staff shortages leading to vacated correctional posts and a non-functional fire panel.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This document is a routine Daily Activity Report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York dated August 13, 2019, covering activities from August 12, 2019.
The report indicates operational issues including a shortage of staff leading to vacated correctional assignments and an inoperative fire panel in the Control Center.
The inmate population at the beginning of the morning watch shift on August 12, 2019, was 757 individuals, distributed across various housing units.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, providing contextual administrative records from the facility where he was incarcerated prior to his death.
